title: Looking for an older article on type classification
content:
Some time ago, there was a brilliant article on classifying (or not classifying) type in the “five standard” classifications. Is that article available somewhere? Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Hoefler\_Classifying Type.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012163913/http:/typophile.com/files/Hoefler_Classifying%20Type.pdf) | 761.05 KB |

 [‹ Veer's top 18 of 2005](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012163913/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17413 "Go to previous forum topic") [academic training in type design ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012163913/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17303 "Go to next forum topic")
author: offonoff

comments.content:
Catherin Dixon spoke on it at St. Bride: [http://stbride.org/friends/conference/twentiethcenturygraphiccommunicati...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012163913/http:/stbride.org/friends/conference/twentiethcenturygraphiccommunication/TypefaceClassification.html "http://stbride.org/friends/conference/twentiethcenturygraphiccommunication/TypefaceClassification.html")

Luc’s extract from the British Standards: [http://jeff.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/britishstandards.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012163913/http:/jeff.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/britishstandards.html "http://jeff.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/britishstandards.html")

Oh. Do you mean the one written by Jonathan Hoefler for Typophile?

Daphne, I attached a PDF version of the article. I did some screen grabs of it a while ago. Still not sure if that is what you want. I know there was an article about it in EYE magazine, but that was quite a while ago.

Or maybe you mean an old thread here on Typophile: [http://www.typophile.com/node/9757](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012163913/http:/www.typophile.com/node/9757 "http://www.typophile.com/node/9757")

Miss Tiffany,

The Hoefler article for Typophile was exactly what I was looking for. Thanks so much for all your help!

Best,  
Daphne
